body: During the Activity phase, you declare new downtime activities or continue existing ones. Activities like beginning construction on a new building, continuing construction on an existing building, recruiting for a new organization, crafting magic items, or retraining skill points or a feat occur in this phase. You may also use this phase to take actions that do not require the downtime system.
name: Activity Phase

sections.body: You can perform any activities that don't require downtime days, such as buying gear, selling unwanted magic items, and bartering.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Downtime/Downtime/Downtime Phases/Activity Phase/Step 1-Perform Free Activities
sections.name: Step 1-Perform Free Activities

sections.body: Your first priority is continuing a downtime activity that requires more than 1 day. Depending on the specific requirements of that activity, interrupting it might ruin any progress you've made. Some activities might require only a small bit of your attention and still allow you to perform other downtime activities in this phase.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Downtime/Downtime/Downtime Phases/Activity Phase/Step 2-Continue Ongoing Downtime Activity
sections.name: Step 2-Continue Ongoing Downtime Activity

sections.body: If you aren't continuing an earlier downtime activity, or are continuing one that doesn't restrict you from starting a new activity, you can begin a new downtime activity.
sections.name: Step 3-Begin New Downtime Activity
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Downtime/Downtime/Downtime Phases/Activity Phase/Step 3-Begin New Downtime Activity

sections.body: Patrick's character has been crafting a wand of fireball, but had to interrupt the process just short of completion to have a short adventure that didn't give him any time to work on the item. When he returns to town and begins a downtime session, he sells some loot in Step 1 (which doesn't use any downtime days), then proceeds to Step 2. In Step 2, he decides to spend downtime finishing the work on the wand, which takes him 1 day of downtime. The next day, he has no ongoing downtime activities, so he proceeds to Step 3 and starts spending Influence to recruit an Apprentice wizard.
